news.title: ‘Shut it down and start again’: staff disquiet as Alan Turing Institute faces identity crisis
news.summary: Whistleblower warns UK’s top AI research body in danger of collapse due to threats over funding and new direction. UK government announced creation of the Alan Turing Institute in 2014.

news.title: Chatbot given power to close ‘distressing’ chats to protect its ‘welfare’
news.summary: Anthropic found that Claude Opus 4 was averse to harmful tasks, such as providing sexual content involving minors. Makers cited the need to safeguard the AI's "welfare" amid ongoing uncertainty about the burgeoning technology's moral status.

news.title: Author Rie Qudan: Why I used ChatGPT to write my prize-winning novel
news.summary: Rie Qudan's fourth novel, Sympathy Tower Tokyo, was partly written using AI. The book attracted controversy in Japan when it won a prestigious prize. The 34-year old author is talking to me via Zoom from her home near Tokyo.

news.title: ‘My buyer’s guilt is insane. It’s $1,300 on trash’: the adults addicted to blind box toys like Labubus
news.summary: Jess has never touched a slot machine, played the lottery or bought a scratch-off, but she fears she may have a gambling problem nonetheless. This July, the 28-year-old found herself spending up to $270 a week on blind boxes – that is, surprise items that are sold in sealed, opaque packaging.

news.title: A new start after 60: I read out my old diaries online – and my youthful secrets went viral
news.summary: Betsy Lerner, 64, has amassed 1.5m likes on TikTok. She reads from diaries she wrote in her turbulent 20s. Lerner has worked as a literary agent for Patti Smith and Temple Grandin.
